title: A Little About Me
text:
::: <hr style=’background-color:#0082E2;border-width:0;color:#000000;height:2px;> ::: I’m a data professional working for Farm Credit Services of America. I live in Fargo, North Dakota with my soon-to-be wife and our goldendoodle, Ellie. I enjoy coffee, taking our dog for walks, working out, and listening to podcasts.
I attended the University of North Dakota and obtained a Bachelors of Accountancy and a Bachelors of Business Adminstration, specializing in Economics.
I began my professional life in finance before finding a career in data. These days, I work primarily with open-source technologies. I prefer to program using the R programming language and use Quarto as my means of communication.
I have extensive analytics experience, having developed an enterprise reporting framework from scratch, creating a Center of Excellence to expand the impact of analytics, and building a loan decision engine which handles over $3 billion in loan commitments annually.

title: What I’m Up to Now
text:
Last Updated: January 2nd, 2024
As suggested by Derek Sivers, here is a list of the things I’m currently doing or thinking about.

title: A Glimpse at Past Projects
text: flashcrash A Shiny app that retrieves a random chart from the Animal Spirits podcast.

title: What I’m Up to Now
text:
Personal Website
It’s been a while since I’ve spent time on refining my personal website. I’m planning to make some additional styling changes and site updates over the coming weeks.

title: What I’m Up to Now
text:
Whoop R Package
I’m toying around with the idea of creating an R package that acts as a wrapper to the Whoop API. I’m a Whoop user and would like a way to programmatically pull my personal data for analysis purposes and to include in my daily brief, which leads me to…

title: What I’m Up to Now
text:
Daily Brief
I want to create a daily brief that pulls together my most commonly used data sources (weather, Whoop, etc.) in a daily Quarto document.

title: What I’m Up to Now
text:
Archer Transcription Shiny App
I want to create a Shiny app to make transcribing the FX show Archer a bit easier. Ideally, I’d like to transcribe the entire show and then create an R package with the data in a tidy format.
